title: Britain's small businesses plead for radical business rates reform
text:
Britain's small businesses are pleading for radical business rates reform to be unveiled in next month’s Autumn Budget.

Chancellor of the Exchequer Sajid Javid must set out a Budget which will help firms left ‘hamstrung’ by Brexit uncertainty, according to the Federation of Small Businesses.

Chancellor of the Exchequer Sajid Javid is facing calls to help small businesses

The business group is calling for Javid to slash business rates for small firms, as thousands are struggling to stay afloat amid spiralling operating costs.

It wants the Retail Discount – which allows retailers whose property is worth up to £51,000 to claim a 33pc discount on their rates bills – to be increased to 50pc, made permanent and extended to small firms operating in other sectors.

It also wants Small Business Rates Relief to be extended beyond companies with up to £12,000 worth of property to those with up to £30,000.

The FSB’s national chairman Mike Cherry said: ‘We need to see the Chancellor step up to the mark next month. Otherwise, we’re in for a very bleak winter.’
